hint_notif_visual: Select the type of visual notification installed.
hint_notif_audio: Select the type of sound notification installed.
step1: Allows you to configure the new name or location
name: Name
NotifHeure_label: Choose a Name or place for the NotifHeureXL
name_length: The name must be between 3 and 25 characters Maximum
info_lastzone: The rest is automatically assigned to the last Zone which will be {lastzone} matrix
info_perso: Allows you to change the order in which the zones will be created
caption_ntp: The time server can be modified in the configuration page
caption_horloge: Indicate the desired size of the clock area ?
caption_xl: Do you want to activate XL mode ( Double the clock display ) ?
caption_sup: Indicate the number of additional zones for notifications ( outside clock zone ) ?
btn_clic: Single click action on Button {btn} | Double click action on Button  {btn} | Triple click action on Button {btn}
infopostswitch: Post type request if selected, otherwise GET type request
postdata: Data POST for URL Action 1 ( optional )
Data POST for URL Action 2 ( optional )
Data POST for URL Action 3 ( optional )
info_config_visual: Default setting for visual notifications and LED / night light mode
config_led_intensity: Default intensity for night light mode
config_dht_laps: Default time delay in minutes for displaying DHT info on Notifheure (if enabled)
mqtt_pass: MQTT server password (leave blank if not used)
mqtt_port: MQTT server port number (1883 by default)
mqtt_tempo: Intervalle de temporisation des publications MQTT ( en secondes )
prefix: Prefix for option discovery for HOME ASSISTANT (homeassistant by default)
urls: Action URL (enter the action urls here). These Urls are called after a specific action (Buttons, timer, alarm, Notification)
functionsinfos: Customization of system functions (alarm, minter, auto shutdown, default pause time, etc.)
optmsgtimer: Message to display at the end of the Timer
charoff_info: Used to define the character displayed by default when the clock is turned off, by default: space (ascii code 32)
pause_info: Default pause time after each notification
flag_info: Selection of the types of notifications to keep in history
config_debug_info: Configuration parameter DEBUG (switches the interface to debug mode for debugging )
saving: Saving of the parameters in progress ...
config_box_info: Configurations of URLs for action (for example sending an http request to a home automation box) and URL Update for an automatic refresh request
config_aln_info: Automatic adaptation of the display, if the text to display does not fit in the notification area, it will be automatically 'scrolled'.
urlactions: Set default actions for Timer and Alarm modes
urlupdate: URL used for home automation API update (this URL is called for each system update)
the good the bad and the ugly: the good the bad and the ugly
mqtt_config_ex: Modifies the name of the notifheureXL in "veranda"
mqtt_txt1: If you have an MQTT error, check the server address, the port as well as the user name and password if it is necessary.
mqtt_txt2: Once the changes have been made, in the configuration page. Remember to restart the Notifheure, so that the parameters are taken into account.
index_opt: list of options, separated by; ( semicolon )
mqtt_send_txt1: It is possible to specify one or more options, for example :
mqtt_send_txt2: for a 0 second pause on zone 1 (separated by ";"). If no option is specified. The default parameters are applied. Send message to the "message" zone
mqtt_state_info: Retrieving the status of the XL time notification in the form of a JSON
listnotif: No other Notifheure | One more Notifheure | {count} more Notifheure
alarm_days: Select days of the week for alarm
info_example2: Possibility of sending several orders : {"key":"value","key2":"value2"} separated by commas.
not_json: The string must be in JSON format
max_input: The string must not exceed {n} characters
haprefix_info: For home Assistant, the XL notifheure creates the entities automatically in HA, if the option is enabled (auto discovery). According to the hardware options of the notifheure, it creates two temperature and humidity sensors (DHT), 3 switches for the Seconds, Auto / manual and clock display options and a "light" entity for the LED. It is also possible to manually trigger the creation, by clicking on the button below.
